raw_body:
Thinking Machines Data Science is joining forces with OpenAI to help more businesses across Asia Pacific turn artificial intelligence into measurable results. The collaboration makes Thinking Machines the first official Services Partner for OpenAI in the region. The partnership comes as AI adoption in APAC continues to rise. The post Thinking Machines becomes OpenAI’s first services partner in APAC appeared first on AI News.
speedrun: Thinking Machines Data Science has partnered with OpenAI, becoming the first official Services Partner for the Asia Pacific region. This collaboration aims to help businesses leverage AI effectively, responding to a growing demand for AI solutions. Notably, an IBM study indicates that 61% of companies in APAC are adopting AI technologies. This partnership is significant as it could accelerate AI integration in various industries across the region.
why_it_matters: Businesses in APAC can now access tailored AI solutions, enhancing their operational efficiency and competitiveness.
This partnership reflects a broader trend of increasing AI adoption in the region, signaling a shift towards more data-driven decision-making.

lenses.eli12: Thinking Machines is teaming up with OpenAI to help businesses in Asia Pacific use AI better. Just like a coach helps athletes improve their game, this partnership aims to make AI more effective for companies. This matters because it means more businesses can harness AI to grow and succeed.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, this partnership means access to specialized AI services that can enhance product offerings. As AI adoption rises, companies need to meet user demands for efficiency and innovation. This collaboration could lead to new tools and insights that improve user experience and operational costs.
lenses.engineer: From a technical perspective, this partnership could facilitate the integration of OpenAI's models into local businesses. With 61% of APAC companies adopting AI, Thinking Machines may leverage advanced algorithms to tailor solutions effectively. This could enhance data-driven decision-making but requires careful implementation to ensure efficacy.
